Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture!
Reviews.Author: David Farr
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace a smaller-screen TV in our bedroom.  The larger size is much appreciated, but the quality of the picture is beyond any I've seen.  We have had other LCD HDTV sets, but this one far exceeds the picture quality of our other sets.  Easy to set up.  I got a wall mount for this size set and the entire installation took just a few minutes.  Highly recommended and worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Best 26" LCD out there!
Reviews.Author: D. Nelson
Reviews.Content: This Sony KDL-26L5000 26" flat-screen tv is the newest and best LCD of this size on the market. Super fine and detailed image quality, fantastic features, and very smooth sound. Very easy to setup and high-def TV looks excellent. If you want the best 26" LCD, get this Sony model!

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD!!!
Reviews.Author: I. Villafuerte
Reviews.Content: my first hd flat panel. spent a considerable amount of time researching and reading reviews trying to decide what would be my first hd tv. but in the end i came across this one, and with confidence in sony, it was a blind buy. been with it for a month now and i couldn't be more pleased with this tv. @ 720p the picture is stunning. blu-rays on this thing are gorgeous, as are my ps3 games. sound is surprisingly louder and clearer than i expected. as a bedroom set you couldn't ask for better. next, the living room set will definitely be a bravia.

Reviews.Title: One of life's little bargains!
Reviews.Author: Warren W. Wiley
Reviews.Content: At the price you may not at first think of this little SONY as a bargain, but wait until you've owned if for a month or so. If you have wasted time trying other, less expensive sets, as many of us have, then you will know what I mean by bargain!Marvelous picture. Easy to set up and program.Easily moved around. I don't understand the negative comments about sound. What do you want?....a stereo system or a television set??!This is a GREAT little television.

Reviews.Title: Best Little HDTV I've Seen
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Leatherman
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller screen HDTV for the basement when I found the KDL 26L5000.  Amazon, as usual, was great.  I ordered on Sunday night, was shipped on Monday and received it on Tuesday. And, that was with free super saver shipping!  It was simple to set up and the picture is great.  The colors are perfect with superb blacks.  It is connected through a DirecTv HR22-100 HD DVR.  This is a great TV for smaller viewing areas like a den, bedroom, etc.  I'm giving 4 stars mainly for the speakers.  I would prefer a little more volume and better bass, but perhaps I'm expecting too much from small speakers.  Still, I really like this set and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Buy this t.v., you won't be sorry
Reviews.Author: Stacey Schooler "Stacers"
Reviews.Content: I bought this t.v. after getting fed up with my Norcent LCD unit. I love this set! The picture is crystal clear from any angle. It's super light, and pretty thin too. It was easy to hook up my DVD and Wii, and I have several ports to spare. It comes with a remote that can be used as a universal remote, which is great. The whole thing is just fantastic, and if you're looking for a t.v. I would say go for this one...you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia L-Series KDL-5000 26-Inch 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Jerry Balloon "Router Champ"
Reviews.Content: I received the 26 inch LCD HDTV from Amazon on time as promise. The box was damage, but the TV was ok.  I am please with this TV and love the picture quality.  It was easy to setup and operate.  The sound quality is ok, but I would have like more bass sound.  Overall I rate this TV four stars out of five.  I do recommend this TV. I also like the design and the black finish.  The three HDMI ports are recommended.  The sound quailty is the only reason that I did not give this product five stars.

Reviews.Title: Good 26" TV
Reviews.Author: M. Burke
Reviews.Content: Needed  a new tv to replace an older one in a home office.  Already had a larger, 47" Sony Bravia in our living room which we love.  This one doesn't disappoint either.  Crisp, clear picture, easy to use, but I do think the sound quality could be better. We are using it in an old entertainment center, not mounted on a wall, and it could be the sound is a bit muffled due to its location. It was easy to set up and overall is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Solid Entry-Level HDTV with great Quality
Reviews.Author: D. A. Theisen
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this thing... not everyone has room or a budget for something 30"+ 40"++ or lives somewhere with vaulted ceilings. At this size, it's perfect for a bedroom or small den. Love the look-- the piano black is lovely and matches other Sony products if you happen to have them (a small theater system and Playstation 3, in my case). While shopping around, I realized that a 1080p would be overkill for a smaller area and were much costlier, and this is a great choice if you care about product brand when making larger purchases while still getting all the features you'd expect out of fancier models of others. Are you paying a little more for the name? Likely, but that can be important for a lot of people, too.Upgrading to a full HD television service is not in the works for me right now and I mostly purchased this for Blu-Ray and the Playstation 3, but normal cable still looks great and this Bravia series has an absolutely great screen display on 'wide zoom' to where you can get a full-screen image without strange stretching and you can still even read the tickers on news or sports channels.Critiques? The sound is somewhat disappointing with iffy bass and muddled clarity, which could get to movie fans. A few things can be frustrating such as channel change time and its dimming feature... sometimes it almost feels like you have to go through a few too many menus, as well. I think the dimming is great the majority of the time, but it outsmarts itself by readjusting because the TV changes the nearby ambient itself with a white picture! These confusions could be troublesome to the non technologically-inclined who just want to turn something on and channel-hop, which is the only reason I can't give a 5/5. Still, there's no reason I wouldn't highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Quality product, great image
Reviews.Author: Kevin W. Parker
Reviews.Content: I'm probably not the best person to review a TV set because the only other one I'm thoroughly familiar with is the 25-year-old RCA set that this one replaced.Anyhow, I'm very happy with the decision. The image is very crisp and clear, and there are numerous input options. I've managed to set up three different feeds into the TV: one from the cable box, one from the DVD player, and one direct from an antenna. All of them work well.If you're used to an old-fashioned TV set that you just turn on and off and change channels on (as I was), this one may take some getting used to as among various other options you can choose among multiple inputs and decide whether you want the image to be normal-sized, widened, or zoomed.That is in fact my one quibble, though I'm not sure if it's the TV's fault or what: I would like to be able to get an image that takes up as much of the screen real-estate as possible without being stretched in any way, and in some configurations that just doesn't seem to be possible. Either there's wasted space around all four edges, or it's zoomed so that the edges of the image are off the screen.But all-in-all I'm very satisfied with both the quality and the price.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff
Reviews.Author: Chris Mcdonough
Reviews.Content: This TV is used in my "study".  It has the following devices attached to it:- A Dell Hybrid Studio PC (Windows Vista) via HDMI- A homebuilt PC (Ubuntu 8.10) via VGA (aka the "PC" port)- A Sony Playstation 2 via composite.- An XBox (original) via composite.Everything works as you'd expect so far.  In particular, the Hybrid (Intel 965 chipset) running Vista is able to drive the TV *over HDMI* in its native 1360x768 resolution (the EDID has the correct info).  This was a problem with a Samsung I bought and returned.  Likewise, the homebuilt PC system (also an Intel chipset) has no problem driving the display at its native resolution (the Samsung could do this too, it just had problems accepting PC signal at native resolution over HDMI because its EDID was wrong).  I have ordered component cables for the Playstation and XBox but they both work OK over composite (albeit not at 720p).I am currently having a slight problem where the "HDMI 1" port loses sync to the Hybrid causing the TV to "flash" (loses both picture and sound at random intervals for a few seconds).  Moving the connection to the HDMI 2 or 3 ports solves the issue, so I suspect it's just a connector problem.  I will likely exchange it for this reason.I'd recommend this TV to others.

Reviews.Title: Buy something else
Reviews.Author: Bill Wolf "Mr Bill"
Reviews.Content: The screen has some kind of auto dimming that can't be turned off with any of the settings.  The screen turns about 35% darker suddenly after about 5 seconds of any dark scene.  It's really annoying as it's an abrupt switch and the change back to bright is also very obvious and occurs after a slight delay. I have this TV in my bedroom and usually watch in the dark where it's even more noticable and annoying.Search google and you will find many examples of people complaining about this.  There is no easy setting to disable this feature.When you watch sports or other constantly bright things, it's a nice picture and you won't see this problem.  But if you watch mostly movies it might drive you crazy.I am very sorry I bought this tv.

Reviews.Title: Nice small TV
Reviews.Author: Deep Spaceus
Reviews.Content: The Good:- Great Picture- Easy Setup- Number of HDMI connections (Connected to cable, PS3, Computer)The not so good:- Sound is thin (but what can you expect from a small TV)- Limited adjustment for computer resolution (only one computer resolution displayed correctly)

Reviews.Title: Super Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: W. J. Magee
Reviews.Content: If you buy a TV based upon its picture quality compared to others in the group, then this is the set for you. Picture quality is outstanding! It's a little pricier than many, but then, you get what you pay for. I also like the fact that the bezel is a dull black rather than the gloss black of many other sets (no reflection). It arrived quickly, and nothing was broken. I bought the set to replace an older flat screen I use on the porch. This set is too good to use on a porch - so it's in my office now.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Frank Jerome
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this Sony HDTV. Easy setup. Nice style. Great HDTV images and color. Nice sound. Outstanding movie picture quality when using a DVD player. Okay for PC use, but display quality does not match most PC monitors that normally have higher resolution screens with more pixels.

Reviews.Title: zony 26" flat wall hanging tv
Reviews.Author: S. Gaffney
Reviews.Content: Am very pleased with our new Sony HD LCD tv...only thing wrong is that the brackets to hang on wall do not match the holes on back of tv or fittings.  Had to redo wall bracket to fit tv...other than that, works great....

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia L-Series KDL-26L5000 - a capable 26 inch TV
Reviews.Author: David L. Paine "dpaine"
Reviews.Content: I needed a set with more input options than is typical.  Also important was the ability to show good color over large vertical viewing angles (from below, especially).  The Sony met both of those requirements very well. The interoperability with a PlayStation 3 was an unanticipated benefit.I do watch over the air broadcasts.  This set seems to have a very capable tuner, but sadly it seems to have no way of showing the signal strength, so positioning the antenna is more cumbersome than it could be.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, just make sure it's not too small for your needs
Reviews.Author: sb-lynn
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for my son, who was moving out of his dorm into a small apartment. We already had our own Sony Bravia 42 inch TV at home, and we love it.No doubt there are cheaper LCD HD TVs out there, but you know when you get a Sony that you are going to get good quality. This Bravia series is no exception. The picture quality is astounding, especially when watching sporting events - you can see every face in the crowd.I don't have much new to add to a review for this TV other than a simple warning that seems obvious - take a look at this TV at the store before you make your purchase online. When I bought this one I figured a 26 inch would be just perfect for my son, remembering my old "giant" 25 inch screens from the past.  However, when this one arrived, it seemed so small. With the HD LCD screen, you really can go a bit bigger than you think.  This 26 inch is great but I wish I had gotten just a bit bigger, especially for a TV that's going to be used in a livingroom area.

Reviews.Title: Buy a swivel stand with this one!
Reviews.Author: rrscar
Reviews.Content: Looks great, easy to use. The choices for tweaking all the settings are awesome.Viewed head-on the picture is stunning, and we don't even have HD input on this set yet, just standard Dish Network. BUT... move a few feet off-axis and the color drains right out of the image, and clarity is reduced. Fortunately we have it on a swivel or we would have returned it right away.Sound is just adequate. This set serves our open kitchen/dining room, so it's mostly used for news and commentary during dinner. We added two speakers to the center channel to be able to hear the talking heads more clearly, and that has helped immensely.

Reviews.Title: Great small sized LCD
Reviews.Author: Mamarazzi
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday gift for my husband.  It's a great smaller sized LCD for the bedroom or office.  We really love it, the only thing is that the picture doesn't look great out of the box and because its a newer model, there wasn't much info on the tweaking websites to help calibrate it.  We ended up using the same settings from our larger Sony XBR4 and it looks great.  Just don't be surprised by the factory settings.....the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, not great
Reviews.Author: jdub "jw"
Reviews.Content: This TV does not quite live up to Sony's usual high quality standards.  Certainly the picture is good on HD channels but the colors are just not quite right no matter how I try to adjust the settings.  Picture is only fair on non-HD channels.  The aspect ratio choices on HD channels all cut off the edges of the picture.  This ruins the multi-box programming on ESPN news and Weather HD.  I had originally purchased a Toshiba but returned it as the sound quality was poor.  This Sony is only marginally better - the sound has a tin-can quality.  Overall - I am satisfied given the low price.

Reviews.Title: Decent value, but tiny on-screen text for menus/info is vexing
Reviews.Author: L. Foley
Reviews.Content: We replaced our 10-year old Sony bedroom TV, which got a lot of use, with this 26-inch set. I chose this size because it was the largest that would fit in the existing cabinet, and this particular TV for the brand and the price ($329/free shipping). The set is lightweight, the picture is excellent, it was very easy to set-up, and the sound is quite adequate for the space.There are a few minor annoyances, however: 1) all the on-screen menus, channel information, and so on is very, very small and cannot be read unless one is, say, 3-4 feet from the TV; 2) the sleep timer is accessed through one of these mini-menus rather than by a button on the remote (the good news: the remote for the old Sony--which has a sleep button--actually works with the new TV); and 3) the wide/normal/etc. settings for the picture do not 'stick,' which means that each time you turn it on, it returns to the default, stretched picture, requiring a manual change if that's not your preference.I suppose we will get used to these things, but one does have to wonder about the thinking that went into these design decisions. Given the aging population and 'universal design' considerations, the tiny text seems a particularly poor choice--I've been wondering if they just scaled down their large-model protocol without fully considering the result in a smaller set that would very likely be used in a bedroom and therefore viewed from a distance at least equal to the length of a bed.

Reviews.Title: Looks and sounds really good to me....
Reviews.Author: MayB "artist2artist"
Reviews.Content: This is, without hesitation, the best TV I have ever had.  Soooo easy to set up....it seemed to have set itself up.  Picture is clear as anything, and I don't even have high definition yet!!  Sound is good..don't find that there is any distortion nor muffling.  The only possible drawbacks are with the "new" technology per se, which is common to ALL TV's:  1- Sound volume will vary from channel to channel, and sometimes even from program to commercial, so one has to constantly be prepared to adjust accordingly.  This did not happen with my old set, as there was some way that sound could be regulated to be consistent, so there is no "improvement" on that score.  and 2- Again, "new technology" is with the picture size variations one sometimes need to play with in order to achieve a comfortable viewing format.  However, as I mentioned before, these changes have nothing to do with the actual Bravia TV, but with the technology employed.All in all, an excellent choice if you are in the market for a new TV.  Sony (Bravia) is the one!

Reviews.Title: Sony Magic
Reviews.Author: J. Dunlap
Reviews.Content: Purchased the smaller screen so we could fit it in existing cabniet. Very pleased with the product, great picture. Took some effort to learn how to use new features along with an older model VCR player.

Reviews.Title: Great small sized LCD
Reviews.Author: Mamarazzi
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday gift for my husband.  It's a great smaller sized LCD for the bedroom or office.  We really love it, the only thing is that the picture doesn't look great out of the box and because its a newer model, there wasn't much info on the tweaking websites to help calibrate it.  We ended up using the same settings from our larger Sony XBR4 and it looks great.  Just don't be surprised by the factory settings.....the only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Dead and Gone after a mere 18 months
Reviews.Author: David Watson
Reviews.Content: My Bravia ceased functioning after 18 months of use.  I took it to a repair shop and found some of the components went bad, but the repair cost would be greater than a new TV.  The problem was not caused by a power surge or any other likely culprit according to my electronics repairman.  Just good old fashioned shoddy build quality.  I had expected more from a Sony.Aside from that, the annoying auto-dark mentioned by another poster was really annoying and will not be missed.Stay away from Sony as it is not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Some Illogic in Actual Application
Reviews.Author: Dr. Debra Jan Bibel "World Music Explorer"
Reviews.Content: This smaller diameter set is often, as in my case, placed in a bedroom, where you would like the option to use headphones so as not to disturb your neighbors or mate. There is NO headphone jack. Samsung took it out also for this size unit, and Panasonic lacks even RCA audio jacks. With some Radio Shack fittings, I was able to rig up my headphones to the RCA audio jacks that are there for connection to a stereo receiver, but since this audio out lacks adjustment capacity, the headphone volume is set and fairly low.  This complaint aside, the Sony 26 inch LCD set is very fine, easy to set up, with simple menus and remote buttons. I even was able to connect my backup recording VCR (via a separate antenna and converter box), knowing of course that the analogue quality would be merely adequate. [My living room has a large Panasonic plasma HDTV and DVD recorder that uses DVD-ROM disks.] Thus, for its particular purpose, the Sony Bravia set is a good and probably dependable choice.

Reviews.Title: Miss the headphone jack
Reviews.Author: L. Schworm
Reviews.Content: This TV would be perfect if they included the headphone jack.  The 5000 does not have one.  The 4000 model did have one and it was a great help for the housemembers who are both hard of hearing and unable to remember how to use wireless headphones.

Reviews.Title: beautiful picture a little less stylish
Reviews.Author: G. Villarreal "?????"
Reviews.Content: A good tv, took a bit of tweeking before it looked perfect, but what tv doesn't? Bought it for my fiance and I for when we get married and need a TV, it's small light weight, so I can pick it up and move it whenever I need to , whether if it's a quick room change or when i move out of house to go back to college. And the best of all it wasn't too expensive, and came with way more outputs and inputs than i know what to do with.

Reviews.Title: Avoid "refurbished" models
Reviews.Author: SJL
Reviews.Content: Maybe the new TVs are okay, but I purchased a factory refurbished model, and have had dismal luck.  The first one malfunctioned within 2 weeks.  I returned it.  The replacement lasted just over 5 months, and the remote IR sensor on the set quit working.  For a month now, I have been fighting with Sony tech support, Sony customer relations, and Sony extended warranty departments, none of whom apparently talk to each other.  They keep transferring me back and forth, because it seems no one wants to actually DO something to fix the problem.New units may be better, but apparently Sony refurbishing department is not so great.  And the "customer service" is atrocious.  Never again.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia KDL-26L5000
Reviews.Author: S. Dyczkiewycz
Reviews.Content: We purchased this set from Amazon Warehouse and couldn't be more pleased.  The description read there was a blemish on the housing, but after thoroughly looking it over, we couldn't find a single flaw!  The picture quality is superb and the setup was very simple.  It has everything you could ask for in a bedroom or small space HD TV.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV
Reviews.Author: Quincy, MA Native
Reviews.Content: We bought this 26 inch for our son's bed room. It was so superb that we then bought a 32 inch Bravia for our bed room and a 42 inch bravia for the living room. All are great SONY products - we have only had SONY TVs the last 20 years.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Celiac's Spouse "AdiosWheat"
Reviews.Content: The choice came down to "other brands" in the 32" class or this Sony for about the same price. I'm glad that I went with the Sony. The menu setup was intuitive and I didn't so much as glance at the instructions. The picture was not perfect out-of-the-box. A couple of minutes doing minimal color/tone adjustments brought it up to real life perfection. Best picture I've ever had on a TV and I've owned a bunch. BEST OF ALL, unlike many other brands, the Sony's speakers deliver terrific sound. I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic, clear picture, easy to use, good sound.
Reviews.Author: takeeta
Reviews.Content: I am always one of the last to embrace new technology so I felt it was time for a flat screen LCD TV.  After much research I chose the SONY Brevia (I had compared it to the Samsung)and I must say this tv has exceeded my expectations in every way.  The picture is so clear I am doubting that I really need HD service. I had heard complaints about the sound but I find the sound to be just fine. The controls are easy to understand and operate. In  my opinion you won't be disappointed with the Sony Brevia. By the way it is the 26" which has the lower resolution of 720psi than what is available on the larger sets at 1080. I can't imagine how clear the larger sets must be as the picture here is excllent!

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: C C "Busy lady"
Reviews.Content: Super TV, great HD for the money.  Sound quality is good, but not great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Sandra Pettry
Reviews.Content: We looked at a lot of tv's in this size prior to this purchase and this was the best bang for the buck.  Looks sheek and the name speaks for itself.  Have had a little problem with sound, not sure if it is the tv or the satellite dish connection.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia L-Series KDL-26L5000
Reviews.Author: Timothy D. Mcconnell
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv.  The picture is great.  The sound needs improvement.  I use it as my pc monitor.  That works well also.  I am satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but malfunctioned in 2 months
Reviews.Author: CDP52
Reviews.Content: Nice TV for the bedroom.  Great picture, sound ok as well.  Unfortunately the IR sensor on the TV broke in less than 2 months.  Since it was under warranty, Sony's options were to bring it in to an authorized dealer for free repair or swap it out for a factory refurbished model.  Because of the travel distance involved with the repair, we chose the factory refurbished option.  Sony said that we'd receive it in "3-4 business days after our return was approved".  In reality, it took almost 2 weeks to get it.  It was shipped UPS ground.  The refurbished model appeared to be brand new.  The warranty period will be the same as the original.  Sony paid the return shipping so that was fairly painless.  Only annoyances were the time to get the replacement and some unclear directions from Sony's customer support.

Reviews.Title: Sony Quality
Reviews.Author: T. J. Whartenby "Incurable Romantic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for our kitchen. It's size is perfect for the location. The picture sharpness and the sound are excellent for a smaller t.v. It is extremely light and was very easy to set up. This is an excellent choice as a second t.v. for the bedroom or kitchen. DVD's look even sharper on it than onmy old Trinitron. The remote is easy to use and the various functions easy to perform.

Reviews.Title: Own xbr32" buying this one for Mom
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: You can not beat Sony clarity on their LCD's. My Mom only has vision out of one eye so she will enjoy this T.V. I certainly enjoy mine. Perfect size for her viewing space! I am ordering it as soon as my credit card cycles.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture; the remote needs work
Reviews.Author: elprez
Reviews.Content: I picked up a 19-inch Samsung to mount on the wall in the kitchen. It turned out to seem a little small. As others have said, when you go from a tube TV to a flat screen, you get much more TV in much less space. Anyway, I returned the Samsung. I was going to get a 22-incher, but was convinced to move up to 26. The TV is nice. These might be minor complaints---but we have basic cable...with the Samsung, the local HD channels (ABC, CBS, NBC & Fox affiliates, and a few more) were on the corresponding channels with our cable guide---the CBS affiliate was channel 202, etc; with the Sony, the local HD channels are all over the place---channel 77.2, channel 123.7, etc. Also, the remote is poorly designed, in my opinion. The jump button is one of the best inventions ever. Why does this remote have it way at the bottom of the device, where it's hard to hold/manipulate. The + and - channel buttons are also at the bottom. It would be nice to have those buttons in the middle of the remote.So far, so good with the picture. The HD channels are really nice. The non-HD ones come in fine, but they're really nothing special to look at. I don't care for increasing the size of the image to fill the screen---that makes it look distorted.

Reviews.Title: Love the Bravia!
Reviews.Author: S. Reichter
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a year, and absolutely love it!  Picture quality is awesome.  While I normally prefer a much larger TV, I bought this one for a very small room, and it is the perfect size for my space.  I would recommend the Bravia line to everyone.  Wish I could have one in every room!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful set!
Reviews.Author: Green
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased this Sony for our dining room about six months ago.  We love this television.  Of course, we knew we would not be disappointed with a Sony,  but was apprehensive to order a large item like this off of the internet, sight unseen.  But the other reviews we read helped us to feel comfortable with ordering this item off of the internet.  We are both extremely glad we purchased this set and would highly recommend it to anyone!  The reason I did not give it five stars in all categories, is because it takes a little while to figure out how to navigate through the menu, but we figured it out!  Otherwise, it can't be beat for the value!  This purchase is a good example of "you get what you pay for".  I will consider a Sony for my next television purchase for another room in the future!

Reviews.Title: GREAT little TV
Reviews.Author: W. T. Levy
Reviews.Content: This is the third Sony TV I purchased.  It's for a small spare bedroom and it's a perfect size for watching TV from bed.  My only issue is scrolling through my "favorite" channels that I programmed, is a bit cumbersome.  My old TV had a special button that would just scroll through the 10 channels that I added as favorites.  On the Sony I have to hit the favorite button then use the down button to scroll to the next channel I want to view then hit select.  Other than that it's a great TV with great sound and picture.  After 4 months of using it I am still very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: great bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: Margot Sarmiento
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for the kitchen or bedroom. Was a xmas present for my husband. He's happy with picture quality and easy set-up. The price and prompt delivery from seller excellent.

Reviews.Title: The Sony Bravia is an oustanding TV
Reviews.Author: Theresa B. Buckhout "Theresa Buckhout"
Reviews.Content: This Tv is outstanding. It has a great picture. I plan to purchase another one in the near future.

Reviews.Title: BEST VALUE
Reviews.Author: Richard Barker
Reviews.Content: DOLLAR FOR DOLLAR THIS IS THE BEST 26" LCD ON THE MARKET TODAY.EXCELLENT PICYURE QUALITY.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, very bright and clear. Very good price too.
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Hallwachs "Bill H..retired AF"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, the picture is stunning, everyone who passes by comments on the clarity and brightness. There are plenty of input and output jacks and every control is intuitive to the point that the instruction manual is not really needed. The only thing that baffles me is that the audio output jack is at a fixed level, I hooked it to my stereo, only to get REALLY loud booming bass or for watching MTV, and the remote control does not adjust the volume of the output and my stereo does not have a remote...a minor item but a bit confusing. I always try to buy SONY TVs, they always seem to have that final bit of quality built in, and I would tell my family to buy one of these in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: BW "Review"
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good bedroom TV , not too big, but big enough. To me this 26 inch Sony hits the sweet spot , don't worry its perfect for a bedroom or small room ... you should watch it from about 5 feet away . Setup was quick and easy, you need to play around with the Sony 4 pre-sets such as "movie mode", "vivid" etc to find the look you like. I didn't need to adjust the color setting at all, and I am pretty particular about this ... so this surprised me. So far after a few weeks I would have to give this Sony a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: Great price for adequate dimensions, high resolution, lots of inputs
Reviews.Author: Russell Duhon "eclectic"
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced HDTV, and this one happened to have a small discount on it when we were shopping. Now that we own it, we'd probably pay full price for a replacement. It is only 26", but at the distances we watch, that's more than sufficient. It has lots of inputs, and while the rated resolution is 720p, if you use several of the inputs the TV will display at up to 1080i. Easy setup (though we don't have cable or an antenna) and great for people with several gaming consoles and other video inputs.

Reviews.Title: Sony, the one and only!
Reviews.Author: C. M. Forrest
Reviews.Content: The minute it arrived in the box all I had to do was put it together and screw the base onto the unit and Voila! I had it set up. There were no complicated instructions or pieces to put together! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Good Looking TV
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: This television is not only pretty handsome, it is extremely easy to put together, essentially it's four screws to attach it to the stand and you are finished. It's very light weight as well. The set up is very self explanatory, the tv walks you through it  Although at first scan, it didn't pick up all my antenna channels but that was easily rectified by moving my antenna and rescanning.  I have always owned Sony, my trinitron lasted over 25yrs so when I went looking for a flat screen I looked there first.  I was open minded enough to look at others but found that Sony had the best picture overall, in the stores at least.  Upon getting it home however, I did have a problem with the first set I received.  Amazon was amazing once they got them in again (as they had sold out of them for a while and if I had sent it back immediately then it would've meant a refund only which I didn't want).  The exchange was effortless, I had another set in my home in 3 days and this one is much better.  I still have some people's scalps floating away from their heads but that problem is fixed if I go to the regular channel on the antenna rather than relying on cable (it only seems to happen on one channel now so far and that, thank goodness, is a network channel).  Otherwise, all seems to be ok, my other problems with the other set have disappeared, it's only been 2 days, but they were pretty evident almost immediately last time so I think I'm pretty safe, although I'll probably still be knocking on wood for a couple of weeks.  I only wish that this was an 1080p as I think the picture problems probably wouldn't be happening if this were the case.  Yet despite the problems with the floating heads, and of course movies and programs not made for HD which one would not expect to show up as if they were, the colors are fabulous and picture is wonderful.  One can adjust to 3 different brightness options for viewing which is a very nice feature.  Overall I'm happy with the tv, it fits where I need it to fit which was my biggest problem, finding a tv which was this size but less than 19 1/2" high and still a good tv, of course I wish it had more inputs (yet perhaps as I update everything else that will no longer be an issue, who knows) and more options but that being said, it is a good tv for the money.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY PERFECT!!!
Reviews.Author: Patrose
Reviews.Content: The Sony Bravia (we purchased the 26") was a great purchase...Consumer Reports recommended it & also recommended buying it on Amazon.com for the best deal.  It's a great TV - fantastic picture & features -highly recommend it!  We had a great experience buying through Amazon.  Best price, user friendly website & delivery in 4 DAYS!!!  WOW - What a deal!  We'll do it again & again.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: sdill471
Reviews.Content: very good tv.The HDMI works but for some reason my sony dvd recorder is not recognized.Would be nice if it had an EPG (program guide).Overall very good TV

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Dean A. Gunnink "Hiker"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this HDTV to use in my bedroom.  It's the perfect size.  The picture is incredible.  The sound is quite good but not excellent, probably what one should expect from a smaller, LCD TV.  We've had it for a couple of months now and are very pleased with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 26 inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cobble
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV and I will buy another. With a the HDTV's out their I am glad I decided on this HD. Others cannot offer what this one has for such a great price. It was so easy to set up and start right away. It arrived the exact day that was scheduled. Now I need Direct TV in HD and will be all set!

Reviews.Title: Spectacular Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: M. B. Yules
Reviews.Content: LCD TV was a cinch to hookup. Great resolution with good sound quality. Decided to go with the 26" inch over 22" display for our kitchen/breakfast nook, and glad we did. Stunning picture quality.

Reviews.Title: TV for Jimbos Farm
Reviews.Author: James J. Kalamasz Recording "Jim Kalamasz"
Reviews.Content: Had an old Sony 19 inch tube TV up at Jimbo's Farm for 12 yearsand still works fine.  Saw this unit in action at a Brick & Morterstore & knew it would be perfect for the place.Set up was dead easy ,  Picture is perfect & sound not bad fora unit this size.Excellent value.Jim Kalamasz

Reviews.Title: Great TV in 26 inch
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Khalid
Reviews.Content: Great TV great price Sony is still the best.I need this TV for my bedroom but it was to small for the area I think you cant get any batter TV in 26 inch then this.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Gram Cracker
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for a bedroom.  It is the perfect size.  It has a great picture and we are very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Adjust's picture size with ease.
Reviews.Author: Robert Johnson
Reviews.Content: I had a Samasung for a few weeks and needed a bigger screen, so I exchanged it and went with the Sony this time.  With the switch to digital our local channels are providing a hodgepodge of different picture formats. Bringing pictures back to where they are not all stretched out ( a practice that otherwise-slender TV hosts are sure to hate, and that stations will hopefully abandon soon ! ) takes quite a bit of clicking and onscreen menu work with the Samsung, whereas the Sony has a dedicated button right on the remote that quickly does the job.  Be aware that some stations (our local PBS, for one) seem to be fascinated by "artfully" switching picture sizes during the broadcast. The one where they show you a tiny picture surrounded on *all* sides with black space is sure to irritate viewers with smaller sets and little can be done to supersize such formats without loosing resolution.  However bringing 4x3 formats back to their original dimensions is a snap with the Sony, and one reason to buy it over the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Is this TV still for sale? I love Sony tv's!!!!
Reviews.Author: Francis L. Valente "franthree"
Reviews.Content: I was looking to get this tv! But I am afraid it is now out of production? I have looked at other retail outlets too! Any one know if Sony still makes this tv?

Reviews.Title: you can't beat Sony televisions
Reviews.Author: jb ole school
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Sharp before I bought this television, trying to save some money.It was trouble from the start. My other televisions were Sony brand and they'veplayed fine for years.  Why did I buy differently, a momentary lapse of good sense.I'm satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money.
Reviews.Author: DRS
Reviews.Content: If you want to buy a new TV every 4 years to keep up with technology then this is the one you want. We bought this product 4 years ago & 2 months ago. On the left  side  of the screen, 1/3 of it is blurry. first sign of trouble is when you turn the TV on & it stayed blurry for 45 minutes & then went normal. Eventually it got worse. you would have to turn it on for 30 minutes & then turn it off & wait a few minutes turn it back on.. now nothing helps. we paid 1600.00 dollars for this 4 years ago & were very happy with it. You would think that spending that much money it would last at the Least 10 years. We had one of the old box  Tv s  back in the early 90's & gave it to our mother when we bough this one & it's still working like the day we bought it. Would I recommend it? No! Unless you want to keep up with the Technology every 4 years.Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia L-Series KDL-26L5000 26-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: M. Krawitz
Reviews.Content: I like these L5000 series TVs.  I have one upstairs and one in my work room.  The size is nice and it looks nice and it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Very Long Lasting LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Richard W. Harold
Reviews.Content: I've had this model since it was manufactured in May 2009. It has the absolutly best picture quality of any LCD TV that I have ever seen. I haven't had any of the problems that some of the negative reviewers have stated. I went to the Sony website for this model and there was a software update dated 10/21/2011. I downloaded this update and installed it in two of these TVs. I didn't notice a change but its always best to have the latest software. Based upon the picture quality and the longevity of this TV I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting the very best model.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Pamela L. Waagen
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my motorhome as I was having knee surgery and moved it to my son's house to recuperate.  It worked great. I had it there 3 months. I have since moved to another state and took it with me for the guest bedroom. So far it's worked great without any problems. The picture is phenomenal. It's hard to beat Sony. However on a computer I bought later, and had registered with them, I had a very difficult time with customer service so I've sworn off Sony because of it. TVs great their customer service is horrible.

Reviews.Title: Long Lasting
Reviews.Author: william hartwig
Reviews.Content: I have used this sony bravia  26 inch tv for 3 1/2 years, still works like new! Very good product.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: Terry Jackson
Reviews.Content: I needed a new television that would fit into my entertainment center. I prefer Sony products. It is hard to find a TV that size now that they make them so big.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for 2 years
Reviews.Author: FarmerBill
Reviews.Content: After 2 years and 1 month the remote sensor in the TV no longer works. I need to control the TV from the back panel. Surfing the web, I see this is a heavily reported problem. Sony is not the brand it used to be. If I don't get any satisfaction out of customer service, and I probably won't, this is my last Sony product.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: J.A.C. "simple guy"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a year and a half, and love it.  It may be "small" for some, but works great for us.  I just purchased a 32" Vizio, and I still like my Sony better even though it's 6" smaller.  In my opinion, with all the new technology in the past few years, my Bravia still puts out a better picture than my new Vizio.  I also like the fact that it has HDMI inputs on the side and the back.  My new Vizio only has HDMI on the sides, and the cords are visible when watching, unless you really bend those cords, which I'm not about to do to $30 HDMI cables.  The speakers on the Sony are not as good as the Vizio, but still good enough for a small room.  I actually blew one of the speakers (my fault) on my Sony, but I'm planning to purchase a sound bar, which will give me a much better experience all around.  I really like how sony products work together, and if the money is available, I would recommend buying Sony.

Reviews.Title: sony tv
Reviews.Author: Chris Marciano
Reviews.Content: TV was of high quality we expectedDelivery was on timeVery satisfied with purchase

Reviews.Title: Finally a TV without problems
Reviews.Author: C. Nakken "It's P"
Reviews.Content: I looked around amazon for so long looking for a good TV for a good price and good customer reviews. This has all three, I got it for my GF and everything worked after I returned the Vizio I bought.

Reviews.Title: Sony LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Shelly A "Grandma Shell"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the work out room and it is perfect. Purchased the wireless headphones and am really happy with both. Makes working out a much better experience!

Reviews.Title: SONY Bravia is the way to go
Reviews.Author: Scott M.
Reviews.Content: My SONY Bravia 26" TV is the easily the best television I have ever owned. The picture is far superior to any of my other sets. I think it is so great because the screen is blacker than most sets. It also is very well made and has extra jacks for multiple inputs. I know I will never need or want to buy an 'upgrade' TV. There is none.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia television
Reviews.Author: Kirsten L. Underwood "dansker"
Reviews.Content: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001S2RDCC/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_titleI bought 2 Sony Bravia televison sets and am very happy with them. Great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Well above average, with notable limitations
Reviews.Author: Great Movie Addict
Reviews.Content: (Revised 2/21/2010: Sorry, folks, the Red push is just too much for the mrs and me. I'm attempting to return this set today, as further viewing with all that red and anemic blue is simply too annoying and can't be corrected. If you don't mind this -- to me -- serious problem, it's your choice. But surely SONY should be able to do better than this.) Purchased from eDirect before I found Amazon's listing. I was swayed by all the 5-star reviews at Amazon (nowadays, as viewed in showroom setups, there's no way to judge image quality). The mosquito noise seen in showrooms appears in my living room as well, though it's not as prominent as on other LCD's. As for comments about "great color", I'm not sure what that oft-used phrase is supposed to mean; this tv is deficient in Blue and has a 25% Red push that glows like neon and often bleeds like the reds on dirt-cheap store brand CRT's. The SONY at least has RGB adjustments, although RGB Gain can only be reduced, not increased -- a really odd design. In one picture mode, Red is pushed 34%, which looks bizarre but which apparently appeals to "great color" enthusiasts. Sadly, SONY doesn't provide color Y-level controls, not even in the miniscule service menu. In Cinema/Warm Mode the grayscale RGB is admirably flat except for a typically elevated Blue "leg" from 40-IRE on down; most LCD's have such grayscales, ostensibly to make blacks look darker (actually, it just makes blacks look blue, not black. The value R16G16B16 (digital black) is a color rarely seen on HDTV's). After some drastic and very tricky RGB adjustments with help from a colorimeter and HCFR software, blacks looked more neutral and the Red push was made at least tolerable, but high-red gamma suffered somewhat. At least it kept most skin tones from looking like terminal cases of third-degree burn, although fair-skinned people often have an unsightly hot-pink tint. The overall image is suitably contrasty and sharp, and SD sources look much cleaner than with most LCD's. With HD and SD, there's some noisy moire in fine-grained objects like sequinned gowns and heavy wool coats, and shimmer when very high-contrast objects move. But those effects are common on many LCDs. Low-IRE gamma is a bit aggressive, making some darks look rather inky, especially with BluRay; thankfully there's a backlight control that helps a bit. Motion is mostly handled well, even without 120-hz gimmicks (which don't work anyway, because refresh rate isn't the source of LCD motion blur). Turn off noise reduction, which adds its own artifacts and makes motion blur worse. Thankfully I haven't seen judder or stutter so far, but I saw a mild case of upscaling jaggies. With a pristine image source, the overall picture is better than average and looks quite sharp and snappy, without phony edge enhancement. I measured the real-world contrast at around 2100:1, an impressive figure, with excellent darks and crisp whites: black and white movies play nicely. Less perfect sources (low contrast, noisy, low-density scenes in fog, heavy rain, etc.) just look smeared and murky -- this is digital video's fault, not SONY's. BluRay looks very punchy and sharp, though BR compression artifacts are easy to spot. As far as a generally cleaner image is concerned, SD-DVD looks much better on this set than on other 26-inchers I've seen. At this size, the difference between 720 lines and 1080 couldn't be seen, even with a 37" 1080p sitting beside it. If your BluRay player outputs 720i or 720p, set it that way; HD-DVD downscaling doesn't play well here. The tuner is fairly fast; channel cruising is a bit slow, but I've seen much worse. Setup instructions warn that channel scanning takes 50 minutes; my scan found 100-plus cable stations in 12 minutes. Audio ain't great, but it's cleaner and louder than averege and works well from its coax output (but no headphone jack!). Viewing angle is narrow, about 15 degrees either side, a tad wider than some others. Overall I'd say it's an above-average LCD, aided by limited RGB controls but marred mostly by annoying Reds and absent the full-featured CIE adjustments found on some sets. It nicely replaces the average low-quality generic 20" or 24" CRT. But if your old, higher-end smallish CRT still works well and can be calibrated, stick with the tube.

Reviews.Title: Great Sony Product
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Keller
Reviews.Content: Love this Sony T.V.  This was a replacement for a 22 yr. old Sony.  Wouldn't purchase any other brand of television!

Reviews.Title: Sony, never again.
Reviews.Author: cooks4jeff
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for our bedroom and I will say the size is just right. However, the sound is not good, the picture is just OK, but worst of all are the shadow stripes running up both sides of the screen, like a burn-in pattern from the edges of 4:3 aspect ratio images. These have been there since just after the tv went out of warranty. I will NOT be purchasing any products from Sony again.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia L-Series KDL-26L5000 26-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: Dan Stocks Jr
Reviews.Content: Had problems with this unit right off the get go, returned it & bought a 32" Sony instead. I always buy SONY products & have for 45yrs. this was my first experience having any problems at all.Knock on wood all my other Sony products have & are still working fine.If I remember correctly this was an OPEN box special that was a display unit so it could have had a MILLION hrs on before I got it?

Reviews.Title: Sony CD player
Reviews.Author: Nutmeg "Nutmeg"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Sony CD player one month ago to replace my old one that stopped working.  It had all the features I wanted, and great price.  It was easy to install into my existing system.  It is a great value.  JIM in CT

Reviews.Title: A very good size and NTSC TV
Reviews.Author: Ahmed Shaker Ahmed
Reviews.Content: It is a very good TV but notice that it is NTSC only ...To whom buy outside USA, be careful, u should buy multi system or buy a converter from NTSC to PAL

Reviews.Title: Bad, Very Bad TV
Reviews.Author: sociallibris
Reviews.Content: Awfuul TV.  No Tint calibration.  Colors are too bright but pale colors are too bland.  Also, faces are often blurry. I went through the display settings but the color settings did not improve.  And the sharpness setting did not change the blurry quality of the picture.And if you use a satellite connection, the TV identification of the programs/channels does not work.  Only your satellite remote control will assist you in identifying what program and channel you are watching.A grand disappointment after reading the glowing reviews for this TV on Amazon.  Returning it tomorrow.  DO NOT BUY THIS TV.  Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Perreault
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty TV, very easy to set up, lightweight, but sturdy.Has a good picture.  Just hope it lasts longer than the 18 mo old Samsung that died on me.  Would have cost $350 to fix.I was told that Sony is a very good brand.  We'll see.

Reviews.Title: GONE HDTV CRAZY!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Spencer C. Mckiernan "Spencer C. McKiernan Jr."
Reviews.Content: I bought my first HDTV last August. Actually it was a birthday present even though I paided half. Then my father bought a bigger HDTV for a HD converter box from CABLEVISION. Well I bought this HDTV from AMAZON for my mother in the upstairs living room for my satellite tv not just to expierence HD but to expierence real digital tv. Well I just bought a smaller HDTV for my father in the garage for father's day ( I had to order another HD converter box from CABLEVISION. I now made my family HD crazy! But my family is so serious about television I decided it would be smart to make all our tv service with as much HD as possible and be 100% digital. I actually have both cable and satellite (DISH NETWORK) because I wanted it both ways (now that's being serious). I now wonder how many U.S. households have four HDTVs? I am a very happy one of them.

ProductInfo.Features:
Enjoy a 26-inch flatscreen with vibrant 720p resolution from any HD source
Advanced Contrast Enhancer with Dynamic Backlight Control Dynamic Backlight Control creates a dynamic contrast ratio of 13,000:1
Three HDMI inputs (up to 1080/60p input capable) , two Component YPbPr (1080/60i capable), and one PC input
Expand your HDTV's capabilities with BRAVIA Link modules, such as BRAVIA DVD Link, BRAVIA Wireless Link, and BRAVIA Input Link
BRAVIA Sync gives you one-touch access and control of all your compatible home theatre devices
Adjusting the brightness of the backlight in real time, which optimizes contrast and reduces power consumption
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Bravia L-Series KDL-26L5000 26-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
